intro: Lucuma ephedrantha, commonly known as the Andean starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange fruits that resemble star-shaped berries. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are evergreen, glossy, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The fruit is edible, with a sweet and tangy flavor, and is often used in traditional Andean cuisine.
